abstract.text: Remove your donations from Siri.

legalNotices.copyright: Copyright © 2025 Apple Inc. All rights reserved.

inlineContent.text: If your app donated a shortcut containing information that the user has since deleted, your app should delete the donation. For example, let’s say that a user sends a message to a contact using your messaging app. Your app donates the
send message
shortcut that includes information about the contact. Later, the user deletes that contact from the app. The app should delete the donations it made that included the contact information.

When a user deletes data from an app, they expect the data to be gone for good. This means removing the data from the app as well as from the system—if the system has knowledge of that data. It’s important for your app to honor this unspoken agreement with the user: to maintain privacy and trust at all times.

There are other times your app should delete donations; for instance, when your app no longer supports the action. In general, whenever a donation is no longer appropriate for the user, your app should delete the donation.
To delete donations made with interaction objects, use one of the
class methods on
(see Deleting Interactions from the System). To delete specific donations, use
, passing in the list of
strings for each interaction to delete. Or use
, passing in the
string used to group of two or more interactions.
If you need to delete all interactions that your app donated—for example, when the user signs out of your app—use
The method you use to delete a donation made with
depends on how you set up the user activity.

Use
, passing in the list of persistent identifiers, to delete individual activities. This method also deletes user activities stored by Core Spotlight that have a matching persistent identifier.
Use
to delete all activities saved by your app; for example, after the user signs out of your app. This method also deletes all user activities created by your app and stored by Core Spotlight.
If the user activity is indexed in Spotlight and the
property is set to a unique string identifying the activity, then:
Use
to delete specific Spotlight items.
Use

Use
to delete all searchable items that your app contributed to Spotlight from the index.
When you delete a Spotlight item, the system deletes the related user activity and its donations.
For more information about Spotlight indexing, see

abstract.text: Add search capabilities to your app, and index your content so people can find it from Spotlight and Safari.
Deletes all searchable items from the index.
Removes from the index all searchable items associated with the specified domain.
Removes from the index all items with the specified identifiers.
The unique identifier for the item to which the activity is related.
A representation of the state of your app at a moment in time.
Deletes all user activities created by your app.
Deletes user activities created by your app that have the specified persistent identifiers.
A Boolean value that determines whether Siri can suggest the user activity as a shortcut to the user.
A value used to identify the user activity.
A true value.
Empower people to customize interactions for your app on their device.
An interaction between the user and your app involving an intent object.
Deletes the specified interactions that were donated by the calling app.
Deletes the interactions with the specified group identifier.
Deletes all interactions that you donated previously.
The unique identifier of the interaction’s group.
The unique identifier of the interaction.
